intro: Einadia nutans, commonly known as the nodding einadia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers that droop downward, giving it its common name. Its leaves are narrow and alternate, often with a hairy texture. Einadia nutans is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
